review_blob: It has nice pale yellow body, hazy. Head is minimal, white, could be better. Great hoppy aroma, lot of tropical fruits with mango dominant and some citrus. Taste is full bodied, with slightly noticeable malty background. Hoppiness is dominant. Very nice controlled, mango at the front and citrus at the finish. Great hoppiness in aftertaste with accurate carbonation. No alcohol noticeable. Outstanding beer.

Has great aroma of tropical and citrus fruits. Hazy, pale body with nice head. Tastes great, has little malty background and powerful grapefruit hoppy finish. Bitterness intensifies in aftertaste. Greatly drinkable, you wouldnt notice this ABV. Top class beer.
Has good bready and malty aroma. Hops are also noticeable, but not dominating. Nice honey body with white head. Tastes solid and full bodied. Floral and resin hops with medium bitterness.
Good yellow body with small head. Also good malty and fruity aroma from hops. Tastes citrus, some resin and grassy notes. Not bad, medium bitterness. High carbonated.
Nice malty and some hoppy aroma. Pours golden with small head. Tastes malty at the front and goes bitter with every sip. Good full palate with resin notes. Nothing special, but solid beer.

Pours black, with strong brown head. Nice look. Aroma is fruity and malty from the bottle. At first smell it feels like barley wine, has some honey notes, but after while you notice very strong roasted, cocoa and coffee background. Good balance. Taste is massively chocolate after first sip. A lot of cocoa, roasted malt and ash feeling. Great oily mouthfeel with almost completely hidden alcohol. Excellent. Bitterness in rather medium, because of well countered sweetness. Unusual...

Very nice brown body with small beige head. Aroma is dominated with smoked bacon. Really good mouthfeel, bread and caramel notes with smoky finish. Bitterness is rather low, like the carbonation. Solid beer.

Pours almost black with brilliant beige head. Aroma of black malts, honey, some citrus, pine notes and delicate coffee scents. Taste is well balanced. Sweetness on the front is immediately covered by bitterness of dark malts and coffee taste. Through the palate you can feel nice pine and citrus notes. Definitely pleasant bitter finish.
beer_name: To l Black Malts & Body Salts Black Coffee IIPA

review_blob: Color is dark brown with nice copper reflexes with almost no head. At the beginning aroma of acetic acid is noticeable, but after this comes with delicate red wine notes. It nicely fits with butter, vanilla and wooden background. After warming up acetic acid is going away and is very pleasant with vanilla at the front. Taste is definitely sour all the way to the end. Begins with nice sherry and wine notes and goes through wooden barrel extract. Bitterness slightly noticeable. It has great level of carbonation. Excellent made beer.
Black body with light brown head. Head is minimal, disappears quickly. Aroma is mostly coffee. Taste well balanced, lot of roasted malts and coffe with chocolate and prune feel. Very nice taste.

Black body with brown glares against light, cloudy. Small head, but very nice, white and thick. Aroma is mostly chocolate, coffee with a lot of spices. Some vanilla scents noticeable. Tastes mostly chocolate and coffee with cardamom and ginger dominant, other spices are dominated by this taste complexity. Nicely drinkable with dry bitterness.

Very nice pale golden color, little bit cloudy. Head is medium, thick. Pleasant aroma of tropical fruits with pineapple, mango, peach and some citrus notes. Full bodied taste with lots of tropical fruits, but with citrus on the front. Sweetness and caramel notes are nicely hidden. Bitterness is high and long lasting. Very solid.
beer_name: AleBrowar Saint No More Single Hop Simcoe (from 2013- )

review_blob: Pale yellow color, cloudy. Almost no head, white rings. Aroma is dominated by strong citrus and ester notes. In taste has noticeable bready malty base, but is also dominated with citrus notes. Nice bitterness, very mild. Has watery aftertaste, but is extremely drinkable. Overall good refreshing beer when chilled.

Black body with medium dark brown head. Powerful dose of chocolate and cocoa aroma with coffee, ash and tobacco notes. Unforgettable, especially with these sweet liqueur and fruity scents. Taste is also powerful. Starts with ash and tobacco, then you get massive chocolate punch with coffee and roasted flavors. Has some cognac and wooden scents in background. Bitterness is nice, malty and hoppy. Great evolving taste, extremely drinkable. Such style, top class.

Dark golden, crystal clear body. Head is quite high, thick, beige. Nice. Aroma mostly pineapple. Tastes very good, but one-dimensional. Pineapple dominant with medium bitterness. Alcohol not noticeable.

Black, against sunlight its brown with noticeable cloudiness. Head is medium, beige and pretty thick. Aroma is weak, but mostly malty, roasted and cocoa. Delicate resin and citrus notes noticeable. Tastes roasted at beginning with maltiness and some cocoa and citrus scents. Not bad but also not memorable.

Pale golden color, almost crystal clear. Rocky white head, thick but reduces quite fast. Beautiful tropical fruits aroma, peachy, pineapple, mango and lychee with malty background. Tastes similar, but bitterness is not so strong, its below medium. Although its extremely drinkable, but you would want more hops. Great balance, great session beer. Well done.

Pale yellow color, quite heavy. Rocky head, but disappears very quickly. Aroma is mostly malty, wheaty with some fruit and floral background. Some vanilla noticeable. Taste is similar, but has dry wooden and alcohol finish. Hard to judge this, but its worth trying.

Black body, red-brown color against sunlight, little bit cloudy. Beige, thick head, nice but disappears quite fast. Nice malty and smoked aroma. Tastes good with wooden smoke beginning. Nicely drinkable. Feels thick with accurate carbonation.

Black body with small but very nice thick beige head. Great roasted aroma, delicate smoked notes. Nice chocolate and oatmeal background. Tastes roasted at the beginning. Has nice chocolate feel and smoked finish. Not so much bitter but very accurate. Great beer, well balanced.
Dark brown body. Head is minimal but thick. Pleasant aroma of roasted malts and delicate fruitiness. Tastes light, little bit roasted malts, fruitiness and some chocolate notes. Weak bitterness.

Golden/amber, cloudy body with minimal beige head. Aroma is strongly malty with bitter orange, fruity background. Tastes malty at beginning, has nice fruitiness. Bitter, long lasting finish. Very drinkable. Nice and surprisingly good beer.

Almost totally black body. Head is medium, brown, non-regular but disappears quite fast. Aroma is good, roasted malts, prunes and delicate coffee notes in background. Tastes very mild and smooth. Has nice roasted and prune taste. Alcohol is masked very well. Pleasantly warming and drinkable.

Pale golden body, cloudy with yeast particles. Rocky beige head. Heavy tropical aroma, mostly pineapple and mango. Delicious. Tastes malty and fruity at the beginning. Also tropical notes are well noticeable. Nice medium bitterness, long lasting. Very well balanced. Very good beer.

Dark amber, clear body. Small head. Has very strong malt base and some smoked wood. Beginning is malty with noticeable smoky notes. Roasted malts and caramel are also noticeable. Bitter finish, weak but pleasant.

Dark golden body, a little bit cloudy. Head is medium, thick but disappears quite fast. Very intensive aroma of tropical fruits like mango or lychee. Very good. Tastes malty at the beginning and reveals all tropical notes in a second. Has good bitter finish which is not so strong, but stays for a longer while. Alcohol is little bit noticeable but overall it is impressive.
beer_name: Brackie Grand Champion Birofilia 2013 Imperial IPA

review_blob: Amber, cloudy body almost without head. Aroma is sweet, fruity, a little bit bubblegum. Some tropical fruits noticeable. Very refreshing taste, light and drinkable. Has some tropical fruits, bubblegum. Maltiness and bitterness is minimal.

Pale golden clear body. Small head but thick, white. Aroma rather weak, sweet, fruity. Tastes very malty. Has nice fruitiness with pleasant grassy bitterness which lasts for a while. Very drinkable. Good beer.

Nice mahogany, clear body. Head is minimal. Sweet aroma, black forest fruits with some caramel notes. Malty beginning, a little bit dry. Finish is fruity and ester. Very delicate bitterness. Nice carbonation.

Pale golden body. Medium head, white and thick. Massively fruity aroma. A lot of tropical fruits with citrus and resin notes in background. Also grassy scents noticeable. Very pleasant. Tastes very sweet. A lot of citrus background. Great low carbonation which gives extremely drink ability. Bitterness is not quite strong, but also pleasant. Fantastic beer.
beer_name: Ciechan Grand Prix American India Pale Ale

review_blob: Dark orange body. Strongly cloudy with big yeast particles. It gets muddy on the bottom of glass. No head at all. Very nice banana, ester aroma with cloves and juniper scents. Tastes very sweet, malty, bready with banana, yeasty flavor. Cloves and juniper noticeable. Very oily in taste. Alcohol is very well masked. Good beer, but for only once for a while.

Very dark brown body, clear. Head is pretty low, but thick. It has nice roasted and little bit coffee and chocolate aroma. Tastes pleasant. Mostly with roasted malts and little bit coffee. Has little watery finish. Bitterness is weak. Average carbonation. Overall good.

Dark brown cloudy body with some yeast particles. Head is minimal and disappears quickly. Sweet aroma, fruity, some honey also noticeable. Tastes suprisingly well. Malty, some roasted malts, coffee and chocolate. Bitterness is rather low, but nice and long lasting. It doesnt look like stout, doesnt smell like and also taste like a stout, but its very nice belgian intepretation of this style.

Dark yellow, cloudy body. Head is minimal, dissappears very quick. Aroma is delicate, sweet. Mostly fruity with peach dominant. Some flower scents also noticeable. Dry in taste. Alcohol is very well masked. Strong, long lasting bitterness. Weak maltiness. Has nice fruity background. Well crafted beer.

Amber body, almost clear. Nice white and thick head. Aroma is sweet, ester fruity with grass and resin notes from hops. Tastes very hoppy, long lasting, but its not heavy. Some delicate butter scents after warming up. Better than standard version.

Dark brown body, cloudy. Head is nice, dark beige. Aroma of rye, little bit coffee and also fruity, citrus from hops. Great combitanion. Tastes also rye and little bit coffee, but gives wonderful bitter hoppy and roasted malt aftertaste. Oily. Great balance and grat beer.

It has dark golden body, cloudy with noticeable carbonation. Head is nice, beige, thick. Has delicate aroma of cloves and banana. Tastes cloves, banana, earthy. Very good oily feel. Good beer with minimal bitterness.

At first sight black body, but its some sort of muddy dark brown color. Head is minimal, disappears quickly. At the beginning aroma is malty and smoky, but after warming up it reveals roasty and heavily chocolate base. Pleasant warming taste. Its very delicate. Starts with smoked and roasted notes and goes to bitter chocolate and cocoa. Bitterness is moderate but long lasting. Gives great aftertaste. Great beer.
Ruby body, crystal clear with quite thick head. Mostly malty aroma. In taste also malty, but has some strange scents. Weak bitterness, but nothing special.

Honey/golden body, very muddy. Head is quite small, thick and white. Malty aroma, little bit grassy hops. But very disturbing are wine scents. I suppose too high temperature during fermentation. In taste you have heavily noticeable yeast and again wine scents. You can feel malts and moderate bitterness from hops which stays for a while. Generally, tastes like homebrew. Below average beer.

Very clear light yellow body with nice white head, but disappears quickly. Aroma is not so intense, but complex. Mainly yeasty, malty, but I would say similar to some Belgian wit beers. Tastes bready, some chestnuts and maybe some wooden. Definitely dry. Taste doesnt stay long. Its not my style, but I appreciate this beer.

Nice dark orange body with medium, thick and creamy head. Aroma of fruits and ginger with pumpkin and malts in background. Intensity rather low. Tastes pumpkin and malty with some notes of vanilla and spices. Nice bitterness which lasts for a while. Beer with distinct character.
Copper, cloudy body with medium head. Has malty and pumpkin aroma with some orange and ginger scents. Tastes sweet but delicate. Nice pumpkin feel. Bitterness present at finish, but very soft.

Almost black body. Brown and cloudy against the light. Nice creamy beige head. Has strong chocolate aroma with lactose noticeable. Tastes mild, creamy and full bodied. Nice oily feel. Roasted malt is noticeable, but chocolate is dominant. Gives interestingly porter scents, but overall very good.
Nice brown/copper, and little bit cloudy body. Also nice thick creamy head. Strong aroma of citrus and fruits. Tastes pleasant with a lots of bitterness from hops and citrus. Really good beer.

Very nice in glass. Brown/copper body, cloudy and opalescent. Thick, beige head. Aroma is mostly fruity with cloves in background. Tastes sweet with some caramel notes. But its typical for dunkelweizen, fruits, banana and cloves. Great taste.

Nice, gold and cloudy body but almost without head. Malty aroma, but some butter and vanilla notes noticeable. A strange surprise here. Tastes also malty with these butter and vanilla notes. Bitterness is weak, but typical for lagers. Breadyt aftertaste and watery finish.
Dark brown body with small head. Weak alcohol and malt aroma. Tastes sweet, mostly caramel. But its watery. Weak and tasteless beer.

Has black body with almost no head. Flat carbonation. Has very good, strong aroma of roast, coffe and chocolate. Even some smoked notes noticeable. Gives watery feel, tastes strongly roasted with charcoal and coffe. Sweetness is light like chocolate notes. Low bitterness. Not bad, but also not so great.

Nice black rather clear body. Head is small, but creamy which looks good. Pleasant aroma of roasted malts, coffe, chocolate and some ash. Some wooden and like sherry scents can be noticeable when beer gets warmed. Has nice medium bitterness, light roasted notes and chocolate. Somewhere watery, not full bodied, but carbonation is proper for this style.
